text: Step RT-PCR kit (Bioline, UK) with the following thermal cycling profile: Reverse transcription at 45°C for 20 min, polymerase activation at 95°C for 1 min, then 40 cycles of denaturation at 95°C for 15 s, annealing temperatures and times specific for each primer pair and described below, and extension at 72°C for 30 s. This was followed by a final extension at 72°C for 7 min. Annealing occurred at 48°C for 1 min, 58°C for 30 s, and 50°C for 30 s for UTR41+/11− [13] , the partial N gene [14] , and the partial S1 gene [15] , respectively.
